UI_visible_response: Read 14 web pagesView Page Details"Black jails" are a network of extralegal detention centers established by government security forces and private security companies across the People's Republic of China. These facilities are used to detain individuals, often petitioners or activists, without legal process. The majority of detainees are citizens from rural areas who come to Beijing and other provincial capitals seeking redress for abuses such as illegal land grabs, government corruption, and police torture. However, the Chinese government has flatly denied the existence of black jails.Black jails are often located in state-owned hotels, nursing homes, and psychiatric hospitals. Detainees in these facilities are frequently subjected to abuses including physical violence, theft, extortion, threats, intimidation, and deprivation of food, sleep, and medical care.CopyTry AgainShare

The majority of detainees are citizens from rural areas who come to Beijing and other provincial capitals seeking redress for abuses such as illegal land grabs, government corruption, and police torture[^2^]. Detainees in these facilities are frequently subjected to abuses including physical violence, theft, extortion, threats, intimidation, and deprivation of food, sleep, and medical care[^2^].
